episodes.synopsis: The 375 million-year evolutionary journey of human DNA begins with the first fish that stepped onto dry land, whose genes are still within us.
episodes.title: Episode 1

episodes.synopsis: About 250 million years ago, fearsome reptilian ancestors began to evolve into mammals, including humans. Their legacy remains in our DNA.
episodes.title: Episode 2

episodes.synopsis: Our primate progenitors had bodies a lot like those of modern monkeys. From them we inherited our versatile hands, amazing vision and capable brains.
episodes.title: Episode 3

video.title: Your Inner Fish
video.synopsis: This documentary series analyzes the traces of genetic ancestry that are present in the human body's anatomical structures, from skin to the senses.
